results.title: Simvastatin decreases stent-induced in-stent restenosis rate via downregulating the expression of PCNA and upregulating that of p27kip1.
results.text_hl: The aim of this study was to explore the exact inhibitory mechanisms of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Restenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023903 @@@ISR@@@ in vivo.

results.title: Liposomal simvastatin attenuates neointimal hyperplasia in rats.
results.text_hl: One single systemic administration of liposomal @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ at the time of injury significantly suppresses @DISEASE_Neointima @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointimal formation@@@ in the @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Restenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023903 @@@restenosis@@@, mediated via a partial and transient depletion of circulating monocytes.

citations.NLM: Afergan E, Ben David M, Epstein H, Koroukhov N, Gilhar D, Rohekar K, Danenberg HD, Golomb G. Liposomal simvastatin attenuates neointimal hyperplasia in rats. AAPS J. 2010 Jun;12(2):181-7. PMID: 20143196

results.title: Prognostic significance of simvastatin therapy in patients with ischemic heart failure who underwent percutaneous coronary intervention for acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: During 1-year clinical follow-up, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy was associated with a significant reduction in mortality (1.9% vs 7.5%, p = 0.048), @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Restenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023903 @@@restenosis@@@ rate (25.7% vs 43.1%, p = 0.033), and repeat PCI rate (25.7% vs 43.1%, p = 0.033), and with significant improvement in LV ejection fraction (31% to 42% vs 32% to 39%, p = 0.042).

citations.NLM: Hong YJ, Jeong MH, Hyun DW, Hur SH, Kim KB, Kim W, Lim SY, Lee SH, Hong SN, Kang DG, Yun KH, Kim KH, Lee YS, Park HW, Kim JH, Ahn YK, Cho JG, Park JC, Kang JC. Prognostic significance of simvastatin therapy in patients with ischemic heart failure who underwent percutaneous coronary intervention for acute myocardial infarction. Am J Cardiol. 2005 Mar 1;95(5):619-22. PMID: 15721103
citations.BibTeX: @article{15721103, title={Prognostic significance of simvastatin therapy in patients with ischemic heart failure who underwent percutaneous coronary intervention for acute myocardial infarction.}, author={Hong YJ and Jeong MH and Hyun DW and Hur SH and Kim KB and Kim W and Lim SY and Lee SH and Hong SN and Kang DG and Yun KH and Kim KH and Lee YS and Park HW and Kim JH and Ahn YK and Cho JG and Park JC and Kang JC}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={95}, number={5}, pages={619-22}}

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits myointimal hyperplasia following carotid artery injury in cholesterol-fed rabbits.
results.text_hl: A 16-day oral treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ strongly reduced smooth muscle cells @DISEASE_Hyperplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D006965 @@@hyperplasia@@@ occurring in both the media and the intima following deendothelialization (19% and 60% inhibition respectively) suggesting that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may be a useful inhibitor of @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Restenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023903 @@@restenosis@@@ which occurs following @DISEASE_Vascular_System_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D057772 @@@vascular injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Dol F, Mares A, Herbert J. Simvastatin inhibits myointimal hyperplasia following carotid artery injury in cholesterol-fed rabbits. Blood Coagul Fibrinolysis. 1996 Nov;7(8):772-8. PMID: 9034557

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits cell cycle progression in glucose-stimulated proliferation of aortic vascular smooth muscle cells by up-regulating cyclin dependent kinase inhibitors and p53.
results.text_hl: In our study, low dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ had no significant inhibitory effect on VSMC growth in normal @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ condition.
